name: Langfuse
summary: Open-source observability tool for tracing agent prompts, tool calls, and performance in AI agent workflows.
recent_updates: 2025 updates include agent-specific tracing for multi-step workflows.

name: Arize AI
summary: Platform for monitoring AI agents, including traces, bias detection, and real-time vulnerability detection.
recent_updates: Enhanced in 2025 for multi-agent systems; integrates with OpenTelemetry.

name: Azure AI Foundry Observability
summary: Unified solution for agent governance, tracing, and monitoring in Azure ecosystems.
recent_updates: Launched 2025 features for Azure Bedrock agents; emphasizes decentralized security.

name: Dynatrace
summary: AI agent observability platform with integration for Amazon Bedrock and compliance debugging.
recent_updates: 2025 release for agent loops; supports engagement metrics.

name: WhyLabs
summary: Privacy-focused tool for safeguarding AI models and agents across lifecycles.
recent_updates: 2025 updates for agentic AI; ideal for blind storage.

name: Opik
summary: Agent-focused monitoring for multi-step reasoning, tool usage, and LLM observability.
recent_updates: 2025 enhancements; part of top tools for evaluations.

name: AgentOps
summary: Leading platform for agent observability with dashboards, alerts, and failure prevention.

name: AutoGen
summary: Multi-agent framework for workflows, planning, and execution with memory and tool chaining.

name: CrewAI
summary: Role-based multi-agent framework for task decomposition and team-like behaviors.

name: LangGraph
summary: Graph-based framework for conditional agent loops, state management, and visual debugging.

name: Semantic Kernel
summary: Framework for memory and planning in agent execution, integrated with Azure.

name: OpenAI Swarm / AgentKit
summary: Lightweight SDK for agent workflows, evaluations, and connectors with node-based builder.

name: Phidata
summary: Adaptive agent creation framework with LLM integration and modular flows.
recent_updates: 2025 updates for under 100 lines of code.

name: Mastra
summary: Framework for complex agent systems with interactive execution and interchangeable frontends.

name: Restate
summary: Fault-tolerant execution framework for durable AI loops without crashes.

name: MetaGPT
summary: Spec-based execution framework with PM/Dev/QA agents for product-thinking workflows.

name: Superagent / Haystack Agents
summary: Prototyping framework with APIs and RAG-focused execution for fast testing.

name: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
summary: Open-source standard for connecting AI applications to external systems, enabling seamless data exchange.
recent_updates: 2025 adoption as internal wiki for agent-tool context sharing.

name: A2A (Agent-to-Agent)
summary: Peer-to-peer protocol for coordination and secure enterprise actions between agents.

name: ACP (Agent Communication Protocol)
summary: Open standard for agent collaboration, functioning like Slack for agents.

name: ANP (Agent Network Protocol)
summary: Protocol for networked agent interactions supporting grouping and time-based filtering.

name: AG-UI
summary: Agent-user interaction protocol standardizing front-ends for interchangeable components.

name: MCP-Gateway
summary: AI-native gateway for connecting, securing, and observing agent-to-agent and agent-to-tool communication using MCP.
recent_updates: 2025 overhaul supporting A2A, MCP, and Kubernetes; open-source project under Linux Foundation.

name: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Gateway
summary: Gateway handling authentication, request routing, and protocol translation between MCP and APIs in AWS ecosystem.
recent_updates: Introduced August 2025 for managing multiple targets.

name: Envoy AI Gateway
summary: Gateway with MCP support for secure and flexible connections to external tools and data sources.
recent_updates: Announced October 2025 for industry standard adoption.

name: Maxim AI
summary: Prompt engineering tool for teams with versioning and governance.

name: LangSmith
summary: Integrated with LangChain for prompt tracking, evaluations, and optimization.

name: Agenta / Weave
summary: Open-source tools for prompt evaluation and workflows in AI teams.

name: PromptHub
summary: Management tool for agentic tasks in customer support.

name: VKTR
summary: Systematic prompt governance tool for scaling.

name: Anthropic Context Engineering
summary: Strategies for curating agent context as a finite resource.

name: LangChain Framework
summary: Four-strategy optimization (Write/Select/Compress/Isolate) for agent memory.

name: Mem0AI
summary: Advanced memory tool for agents handling shared states.

name: Galileo / Kubiya
summary: Tools for deep context dives in agents with error recovery.

name: Neon Database
summary: Serverless Postgres with RAG for memory architectures.

name: Pinecone
summary: High-speed vector DB for agents and production RAG.

name: Qdrant
summary: Open-source vector DB for hybrid search in AI assistants.

name: Weaviate
summary: Modular vector DB for large-scale embeddings in business-grade RAG.

name: Milvus / Chroma
summary: Scalable open-source vector DBs for decentralized agents.

name: Vespa / FAISS
summary: AI-focused vector DBs for embeddings in real-world tasks.

name: NVIDIA H100/H200/A100
summary: High-performance GPUs for AI workloads, inference, and fine-tuning.
category: Compute and GPU Allocation for Inference, Fine-Tuning, and Experimentation
recent_updates: 2025 top for VRAM in large models.

name: AWS/GCP/Azure Cloud GPUs
summary: Managed cloud services for on-demand GPU allocation.
category: Compute and GPU Allocation for Inference, Fine-Tuning, and Experimentation
recent_updates: 2025 for instant access; compare with decentralized options.

name: GMI Cloud / Thunder Compute
summary: Specialized platforms for AI inference and fine-tuning with H100 access.
category: Compute and GPU Allocation for Inference, Fine-Tuning, and Experimentation

name: IO.net / Render
summary: Decentralized GPU networks for agent demands and limitless power.
category: Compute and GPU Allocation for Inference, Fine-Tuning, and Experimentation

name: Spheron
summary: Guide and platform for ML GPUs in workflows.
category: Compute and GPU Allocation for Inference, Fine-Tuning, and Experimentation

name: Apache Spark
summary: Big data processing tool for agent data distribution and real-time analytics.

name: Google BigQuery / Snowflake
summary: Cloud-based platforms for large datasets and scalable MapReduce in AI agents.

name: AI Map-Reduce (Claude-based)
summary: Pattern for scaling AI tasks using MapReduce in headless mode.

name: Sentient / Nillion
summary: Decentralized tools for agent data with blind compute and multi-agent decomposition.

name: SQD (Onchain Data Lake)
summary: Verifiable onchain data lake for AI agent data highways with EigenDA integration.

name: Okta Auth for Gen AI
summary: Authentication platform for AI agents providing least privileged access to sensitive data and secure API actions.

name: Aembit
summary: Platform for authenticating AI agents in agentic systems, addressing MCP architecture.
recent_updates: 2025 guide for authentication in agentic AI.
best_practices: Treat agents as first-class identities, multi-factor auth.

name: Kite AI / Proof of AI
summary: Cryptographically secure transaction layer solving M x N authentication problem for agents and tools.
best_practices: Proof of AI for identity verification, action tracking.

name: Reclaim Protocol
summary: ZK-TLS protocol for verifiable AI agent actions on blockchain, certifying inference outputs.
recent_updates: 2025 integration with EigenLayer for decentralized zkTLS.

name: idOS
summary: Web3 identity system for AI agents, providing verifiable credentials across blockchains.
recent_updates: 2025 for secure agent operations in DAOs and wallets.

name: Expand
summary: Trustless authentication layer using ZK-proofs for secure AI agent data access.
recent_updates: Launched March 2025 with SDKs and open-sourced components.
best_practices: Zero-knowledge for sensitive data, decentralized verification.

name: Cerbos
summary: Authorization tool for securing AI agents with MCP, focusing on identity and access.

name: OAuth for MCP
summary: Emerging pattern using OAuth 2.1 for MCP authorization, with gateway-based policies.
best_practices: Resource indicators, short-lived tokens, audit boundaries.

name: Wach AI
summary: AI agent verification platform ensuring trust in onchain actions with staking rewards.
best_practices: Universal verifier for no rugs or rogue code.

name: FractionAI
summary: Security measures for AI agents including OAuth delegation, prompt hardening, and anomaly detection.
